TOGETHER WITH
</p>
</th>
<th class="clear" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400">
<a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/trackclk/N7442.3407870MORNINGBREW/B25957551.305077294;dc_trk_aid=497873726;dc_trk_cid=152108492;dc_lat=;dc_rdid=;tag_for_child_directed_treatment=;tfua=;ltd=" style="border-bottom:none!important;" target="_blank" class=""><img alt="Webex by Cisco" style="width:100%;max-width: 143px; display: inline; vertical-align: middle;" width="143" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL2NvbXBhbnkvbG9nby8yNDgvMTYyMzE3ODAzOC13ZWJleGJ5Y2lzY28tM2QtaG9yaXpvbnRhbC1jb2xvcl9fMV8ucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0IjoiY29tZXQtbW9ybmluZ2JyZXciLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ=="></a>

<td style="padding-top:20px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning. </strong>It’s July 1, about 50% through the year, and we could all use a halftime pump-up speech. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Because it ain’t about how hard you hit, it’s about how hard you can get hit and keep moving forward. No one—and we mean <em>no one</em>—comes into our house and pushes us around. This is your time. Their time is done. It’s over. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Remember readers, there's heroes and there's legends. Heroes get remembered but legends never die, and ducks fly together.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Now who’s ready for Q3???????</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GEOPOLITICS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/30/chinas-communist-party-turns-100?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
China's Communist Party at 100
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/30/chinas-communist-party-turns-100?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Chinese Communist Party's 100th anniversary ceremony " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81NjIyL2NoaW5hX2NlcmVtb255LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Lintao Zhang/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Chinese Communist Party is celebrating its 100th birthday today, and it wants to show the world it still has all of its teeth.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Chinese social media is abuzz, coal miners are getting off work to reduce air pollution, and President Xi Jinping delivered a speech that he hopes will establish him as the most powerful Communist Party leader since Mao Zedong.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Of foreign adversaries who try to bully China, Xi said, "Anyone who dares try to do that will have their heads bashed bloodied against the Great Wall of Steel." </span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The origin story</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Mao was one of the original <a href="https://www.gzeromedia.com/viewpoint/whats-the-significance-of-this-weeks-birthday-celebration-in-china?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">13 members</a> who attended the first party congress in July 1921 (it was actually held on July 23, but Mao misremembered and established the holiday on July 1). At the time, China was a poor, mostly agricultural country of 400 million people plagued by civil war and unrest. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">After the Communists gained power in the 1949 revolution, Mao initiated a series of disastrous economic reforms that led to the deaths of tens of millions of people. The China that we know today only began to take shape in the late 1970s, when Mao’s successor, Deng Xiaoping, opened up its market to international investors and established private property rights.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">What happened next is the stuff of economic legend.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>GDP rose from $191 billion in 1980 to $14.3 trillion in 2019.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>More than 770 million people were brought out of poverty.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>China will eclipse the US as the world’s largest economy by 2028, per one estimate.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Since the liberalization of China’s economy, the country has developed a close business relationship with the West—just last week Nike’s CEO <a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/business-57606588?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a>, “Nike is a brand that is of China and for China.” But China’s authoritarian government, territorial ambitions, and alleged human rights abuses have created deep splinters in its relations with democracies. Its caginess around the origins of Covid-19 has made things worse.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>At 100 years old, the Communist Party remains a potent global force led by a president who could be the first since Mao to rule until he dies. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FINANCE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/30/finra-levies-robinhood-biggest-fine-ever?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Robinhood’s Feeling Fined, Thanks
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/30/finra-levies-robinhood-biggest-fine-ever?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="A check made out to Finra from Robinhood" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81NjE4L3JvYmluaG9vZF9maW5yYV9maW5lLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Robinhood was just handed the <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/robinhood-agrees-to-pay-70-million-to-settle-regulatory-investigation-11625063765?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">biggest fine</a> from the Financial Industry Regulatory Authority...ever. It will pay $57 million to Finra and nearly $13 million to harmed investors for a total of $70 million.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What did it allegedly do? </strong>Finra accused Robinhood of misleading customers and for failing to provide support to them when asked. Some examples:</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>A feature that was supposed to allow users to block their ability to trade with borrowed money did not work for certain trades.</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Glitches resulted in traders seeing inaccurate balances. One 20-year-old died by suicide in June 2020 after seeing -$720,000 in his account, when his balance was actually about half that. </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Two major outages resulted in tens of thousands of losses for users who weren’t able to conduct trades and couldn’t reach customer service agents. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In addition to the technical problems, Finra claims that Robinhood, in its pursuit of “democratizing finance,” let too many inexperienced traders make high-risk trades without properly educating them.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>Robinhood confidentially <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2021/06/30/investing/robinhood-trading-fine-finra/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">filed to go public</a> in March, and like a college student 10 minutes before their parents visit, it’s hurriedly cleaning up and happy to see this particular stain fade. Its IPO paperwork is expected any day now.</p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ANTITRUST
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/30/amazon-files-motion-remove-lina-khan-companys-antitrust-investigations?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Amazon to Lina Khan: None of Your Beeswax
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Amazon <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/06/30/amazon-seeks-recusal-of-ftc-chair-lina-khan-in-antitrust-probes.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">filed</a> a motion yesterday to keep Federal Trade Commission Chairwoman Lina Khan out of ongoing antitrust investigations because of her past criticisms of the company.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Amazon’s spokesperson Jack Evans said, “Chair Khan’s body of work and public statements demonstrate that she has prejudged the outcome of matters the FTC may examine during her term.”</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>In other words, Amazon feels like “Queen Victoria” arriving to </span><span><em>Bachelor in Paradise</em></span><span>: already the bad guy.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Who is Lina Khan? </strong>The Yale Law grad was sworn in as chair of the FTC this month. Khan is the Matt Damon of antitrust: broadly popular and famous because of something she made when she was 27. In her 2017 <em>Yale Law Journal</em> <a href="https://www.yalelawjournal.org/note/amazons-antitrust-paradox?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">article</a>, Khan argued that current US antitrust law needs to be overhauled to confront...well, Amazon.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out:</strong> With a swarm of antitrust bills <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2021/06/24/technology/antitrust-overhaul-congress.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">floating</a> around Capitol Hill, scrutiny over its proposed acquisition of MGM, and regulators <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2020/8/3/21352990/new-york-california-ftc-amazon-investigation-marketplace?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">poking into</a> its relationship with third-party sellers, Amazon thinks going on offense is the best defense.</p>

<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">

<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

<font color="#000000">
The Winning Hybrid Work Formula
</font></a>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Formula 1 racing is complicated. <em>Extremely complicated</em>. Trying to figure out how to turn a car into a steerable ground rocketship? No thanks. We can barely toast a bagel.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So when the McLaren F1 Team needed to turn to hybrid work over the past year, it’s safe to say they needed <strong style="color:#000">a solution that</strong> <strong style="color:#000">made virtual collaboration seamless</strong>. When communication and precision are key to your performance, you need a collab tool to keep up. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">McLaren’s pick was obvious: <a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/trackclk/N7442.3407870MORNINGBREW/B25957551.305077294;dc_trk_aid=497873726;dc_trk_cid=152108492;dc_lat=;dc_rdid=;tag_for_child_directed_treatment=;tfua=;ltd=" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Webex</a>.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">With Webex, McLaren is collaborating like they never have before. (Just look at how happy Lando looks up there.) And who can blame him?! In a sport where precision is paramount, <a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/trackclk/N7442.3407870MORNINGBREW/B25957551.305077294;dc_trk_aid=497873726;dc_trk_cid=152108492;dc_lat=;dc_rdid=;tag_for_child_directed_treatment=;tfua=;ltd=" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Webex enables real-time communication</a> for the McLaren Formula 1 Team.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/trackclk/N7442.3407870MORNINGBREW/B25957551.305077294;dc_trk_aid=497873726;dc_trk_cid=152108492;dc_lat=;dc_rdid=;tag_for_child_directed_treatment=;tfua=;ltd=" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Learn more about how Webex is driving hybrid work</a>.</p>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GRAB BAG
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/30/key-performance-indicators-july-1?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Key Performance Indicators
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Stat: </strong>If you want to go to bat for Big Tech in DC, there’s a <a href="https://twitter.com/orientaljanedoe?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">job (or hundreds) for you</a>. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Amazon has 76 openings for “government affairs”</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Apple has 98 openings for “government affairs”</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Facebook has 583 openings for “public policy manager” </span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Google has 103 openings for “public policy manager” </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Quote: </strong>“The largest on record in the history of American theater” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The Yale School of Drama announced a <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2021/06/30/yale-drops-drama-school-tuition-after-david-geffens-150m-donation.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$150 million donation</a> from entertainment mogul David Geffen that will make it tuition-free for current and future students. The department, whose alumni include Meryl Streep and Lupita Nyong’o, will be renamed the David Geffen School of Drama at Yale, proving nothing is truly free.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Read:</strong> What deadlines do to lifetimes. (<a href="https://www.newyorker.com/magazine/2021/07/05/what-deadlines-do-to-lifetimes?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">New Yorker</a>)</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"></p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TRAFFIC
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/30/new-york-worst-traffic-us?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
And Now, Your Morning Traffic Report
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/30/new-york-worst-traffic-us?utm_source=morning_brew" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="NEW YORK, NEW YORK - DECEMBER 07: Cars drive along 2nd Avenue in Murray ..." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81NjIxL2VudGVydGFpbm1lbnRfdG91cmlzbV9pLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Noam Galai/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">New Yorkers have one less excuse to complain about Los Angeles, because the country’s worst <a href="https://news.yahoo.com/study-reveals-city-worst-traffic-223420982.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">stop-and-go conditions</a> moved to the East Coast last year. A study from Texas A&M found that drivers in the New York-Newark area spent 494,268 hours in traffic in 2020, compared to 365,543 hours for those in LA.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">It’s the first time LA has lost its traffic title in nearly 30 years.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>The average metropolitan driver spent ~41 hours in traffic last year, but drivers in the US’ five most-congested metro areas spent much more:</p>
<ol>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>New York-Newark: 56</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Boston: 50</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Houston: 49</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Los Angeles-Long Beach-Anaheim: 46</span></li>
<li aria-level="1" style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>San Francisco-Oakland: 46</span></li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Like the Knicks’ playoff appearance, this traffic ranking is a pandemic-era anomaly. LA will likely reclaim the crown this year as businesses reopen and Angelenos leave their homes for more than just In-N-Out.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Sidekick recs: </strong>The most popular recs from our Sidekick newsletter last week were 1) a <a href="https://www.bonappetit.com/story/dessert-dip-dunkaroos-for-adults?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">dessert dip</a> that’s basically a Dunkaroos for adults, 2) Stanley’s 40-ounce <a href="https://www.stanley1913.com/products/adventure-quencher-travel-tumbler-40-oz?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">travel tumbler</a>, and 3) this <a href="https://thecushionlab.com/products/ergonomic-seat-cushion?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">pressure relief seat cushion</a>. <table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
GAMES
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Puzzle Section
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Brew Mini: </strong>If you can complete it in under two minutes, you’ll beat us. <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/30/brew-mini-sprint?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Play it here</a>. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Three Headlines and a Lie</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If there are two French things we love talking about they are 1) the kitchen staff from <em>Ratatouille</em> and 2) the Tour de France. But because Disney hasn’t announced <em>Remy’s Return</em> yet, we thought we’d do a biking-themed Three Headlines and a Lie. See if you can spot the fake news story.</p>
<ol style="list-style-type: lower-alpha;">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Cyclist </span><span><a href="https://www.cyclingnews.com/news/egan-bernal-chased-up-giro-ditalia-climb-by-chainsaw-wielding-fans/?utm_source=Eurasia+Group+Signal&utm_campaign=0a2af0ee92-EMAIL_CAMPAIGN_2021_06_29_10_49&utm_medium=email&utm_term=0_e605619869-0a2af0ee92-170222949" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">chased</a></span><span> up Giro d'Italia climb by chainsaw-wielding fans</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Tampa’s naked bike ride </span><span><a href="https://media2.giphy.com/media/3oxRmbs0xF77u9PQE8/giphy.gif?cid=ecf05e47qef2wlxt9r8eb3l9o5h66rh3cu0hvhzzrktbc8ah&rid=giphy.gif&ct=g" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">canceled</a></span><span><span> after crop-top debate turns into city council shouting match </span></span><span>
</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>California brand </span><span><a href="https://www.bicycleretailer.com/industry-news/2021/06/08/california-brand-launches-3d-printed-bike-helmet-crowdfuding-campaign?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">launches</a></span><span><span> 3D-printed bike helmet with crowdfunding campaign</span></span><span>
</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Little Tikes </span><span><a href="https://www.engadget.com/little-tikes-smart-stationary-bike-kids-peloton-004602271.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">made</a></span><span><span> a Peloton-style stationary bike for kids</span></span><span>
</span>
</li>
</ol>
</td>

style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nGEOPOLITICS \n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nChina's Communist Party at 100\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2021/06/30/chinas-communist-party-turns-100?utm_source=morning_brew\" style=\"text-decoration:none;border:none;\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Chinese Communist Party's 100th anniversary ceremony \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81NjIyL2NoaW5hX2NlcmVtb255LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19\"\u003e\n\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eLintao Zhang/Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe Chinese Communist Party is celebrating its 100th birthday today, and it wants to show the world it still has all of its teeth.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eChinese social media is abuzz, coal miners are getting off work to reduce air pollution, and President Xi Jinping delivered a speech that he hopes will establish him as the most powerful Communist Party leader since Mao Zedong.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eOf foreign adversaries who try to bully China, Xi said, \"Anyone who dares try to do that will have their heads bashed bloodied against the Great Wall of Steel.\" \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe origin story\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMao was one of the original \u003ca href=\"https://www.gzeromedia.com/viewpoint/whats-the-significance-of-this-weeks-birthday-celebration-in-china?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e13 members\u003c/a\u003e who attended the first party congress in July 1921 (it was actually held on July 23, but Mao misremembered and established the holiday on July 1). At the time, China was a poor, mostly agricultural country of 400 million people plagued by civil war and unrest. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAfter the Communists gained power in the 1949 revolution, Mao initiated a series of disastrous economic reforms that led to the deaths of tens of millions of people. The China that we know today only began to take shape in the late 1970s, when Mao’s successor, Deng Xiaoping, opened up its market to international investors and established private property rights.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhat happened next is the stuff of economic legend.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eGDP rose from $191 billion in 1980 to $14.3 trillion in 2019.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMore than 770 million people were brought out of poverty.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eChina will eclipse the US as the world’s largest economy by 2028, per one estimate.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eSince the liberalization of China’s economy, the country has developed a close business relationship with the West—just last week Nike’s CEO \u003ca href=\"https://www.bbc.com/news/business-57606588?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e, “Nike is a brand that is of China and for China.” But China’s authoritarian government, territorial ambitions, and alleged human rights abuses have created deep splinters in its relations with democracies. Its caginess around the origins of Covid-19 has made things worse.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eAt 100 years old, the Communist Party remains a potent global force led by a president who could be the first since Mao to rule until he dies. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eRobinhood was just handed the \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/robinhood-agrees-to-pay-70-million-to-settle-regulatory-investigation-11625063765?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebiggest fine\u003c/a\u003e from the Financial Industry Regulatory Authority...ever. It will pay $57 million to Finra and nearly $13 million to harmed investors for a total of $70 million.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat did it allegedly do? \u003c/strong\u003eFinra accused Robinhood of misleading customers and for failing to provide support to them when asked. Some examples:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eA feature that was supposed to allow users to block their ability to trade with borrowed money did not work for certain trades.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eGlitches resulted in traders seeing inaccurate balances. One 20-year-old died by suicide in June 2020 after seeing -$720,000 in his account, when his balance was actually about half that. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eTwo major outages resulted in tens of thousands of losses for users who weren’t able to conduct trades and couldn’t reach customer service agents. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn addition to the technical problems, Finra claims that Robinhood, in its pursuit of “democratizing finance,” let too many inexperienced traders make high-risk trades without properly educating them.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003eRobinhood confidentially \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2021/06/30/investing/robinhood-trading-fine-finra/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efiled to go public\u003c/a\u003e in March, and like a college student 10 minutes before their parents visit, it’s hurriedly cleaning up and happy to see this particular stain fade. Beeswax\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAmazon \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2021/06/30/amazon-seeks-recusal-of-ftc-chair-lina-khan-in-antitrust-probes.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efiled\u003c/a\u003e a motion yesterday to keep Federal Trade Commission Chairwoman Lina Khan out of ongoing antitrust investigations because of her past criticisms of the company.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAmazon’s spokesperson Jack Evans said, “Chair Khan’s body of work and public statements demonstrate that she has prejudged the outcome of matters the FTC may examine during her term.”\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIn other words, Amazon feels like “Queen Victoria” arriving to \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cem\u003eBachelor in Paradise\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e: already the bad guy.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWho is Lina Khan? \u003c/strong\u003eThe Yale Law grad was sworn in as chair of the FTC this month. Khan is the Matt Damon of antitrust: broadly popular and famous because of something she made when she was 27. In her 2017 \u003cem\u003eYale Law Journal\u003c/em\u003e \u003ca href=\"https://www.yalelawjournal.org/note/amazons-antitrust-paradox?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003earticle\u003c/a\u003e, Khan argued that current US antitrust law needs to be overhauled to confront...well, Amazon.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out:\u003c/strong\u003e With a swarm of antitrust bills \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2021/06/24/technology/antitrust-overhaul-congress.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efloating\u003c/a\u003e around Capitol Hill, scrutiny over its proposed acquisition of MGM, and regulators \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2020/8/3/21352990/new-york-california-ftc-amazon-investigation-marketplace?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epoking into\u003c/a\u003e its relationship with third-party sellers, Amazon thinks going on offense is the best collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNew Yorkers have one less excuse to complain about Los Angeles, because the country’s worst \u003ca href=\"https://news.yahoo.com/study-reveals-city-worst-traffic-223420982.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estop-and-go conditions\u003c/a\u003e moved to the East Coast last year. A study from Texas A\u0026M found that drivers in the New York-Newark area spent 494,268 hours in traffic in 2020, compared to 365,543 hours for those in LA.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIt’s the first time LA has lost its traffic title in nearly 30 years.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eThe average metropolitan driver spent ~41 hours in traffic last year, but drivers in the US’ five most-congested metro areas spent much more:\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003col\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eNew York-Newark: 56\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBoston: 50\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eHouston: 49\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eLos Angeles-Long Beach-Anaheim: 46\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli aria-level=\"1\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eSan Francisco-Oakland: 46\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ol\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eLike the Knicks’ playoff appearance, this traffic ranking is a pandemic-era anomaly.
